summary: 3D mobile-friendly slice-of-life adventure/visual-novel hybrid set entirely in Puro’s library, focused on building friendship/trust through dialogue and cozy activities, featuring multiple endings including a low-friendship Betrayal ending with Special Edition variants.
architectural_notes: Core gameplay loop centered on a hub-based, single-location library environment with repeatable daily activities and relationship progression.
Ending selection logic driven primarily by Trust/Friendship thresholds (including Special Edition sub-variants for very low vs slightly low friendship).
Project should include a clear startup/entrypoint file (e.g., main executable scene/script) used by build/deployment to launch the game.

Startup/New Game depends on an Internet Computer canister method call (startNewGame); app should handle canister availability (stopped) with preflight/health checks and user-facing recovery messaging.

Backend availability requirement: keep the Internet Computer canister running/always-online (monitoring + auto-restart/ops process) to prevent launch flows (startNewGame/continueGame) from failing due to a stopped canister.

Potential scope conflict: IC canisters generally cannot be started/stopped from within the app/canister itself; any server on/off control likely must be an ops/admin-only external action (or simulated locally) rather than a true canister lifecycle toggle.
User reiterates requirement for an in-app switch to set the backend/server online/offline (true on/off control), which may conflict with IC canister lifecycle limitations.
User requests admin-only switches be restricted by a specific username (not by Internet Identity principal), implying some form of username capture/storage and a trust model for admin gating.
Admin-mode gating username updated: unlock admin-only controls only when entered username exactly matches "hood".
known_issues: Art/style scope conflict: user requests a 3D game, but gameplay style mentions 2D pixel art aesthetics—needs final decision on visual style.
App/game fails to start when clicking the startup/entrypoint (startup launch issue reported by user).
New Game fails with IC0508 non_replicated_rejection: canister pmng3-byaaa-aaaag-awtia-cai is stopped (reject_code 5), resulting in Game Mounted: No.

React runtime error: "Maximum update depth exceeded" indicating an infinite render/update loop (likely repeated setState in componentDidUpdate/componentWillUpdate or an effect without stable dependencies).

Request conflict risk: user asked for an in-app server on/off switch, but existing requirement states the terminal must not claim to start/stop/restart the backend canister; needs clarification/decision (admin-only external control vs simulated toggle).

Admin gating approach conflict: earlier plan uses Internet Identity principal; user now requests username-based gating, which may be spoofable without strong authentication—needs a decision on security model.
Deployment to network failed (deployment error); user requested retry deployment.

existing_features.title: Create a single-location 3D game scene set entirely in a dim, cozy, dusty library with bookshelves, vents, and a central fruit-bearing bonsai tree that the player can explore.
Implement mobile-friendly controls for the 3D gameplay, including touch movement and camera control, with a desktop fallback (keyboard/mouse) for testing.
Add a Relationship system with a visible Trust/Friendship meter that changes based on player choices and activities, and use it to gate or alter dialogue openness and story outcomes.

Implement an interactive dialogue tree system for conversations with Puro, including choices that can increase or decrease Trust/Friendship and questions about the lab, the Pale virus, Puro’s nature, and his interest in humans.
Create a Hangout/Daily routine loop inside the library with at least these activities: reading together, listening to Puro’s stories, and feeding oranges from the bonsai tree.
Add cozy mini-games accessible from the library: (1) Book Sorting, (2) Drawing Lessons/Viewing Drawings, (3) Hide-and-Seek among the bookshelves.
Implement library customization: allow the player to find items in vents and place them in the library to make it more comfortable.
Ensure the game contains no transfurring mechanic: any accidental contact with Puro is treated as a benign interaction (hug/playful shove) and cannot harm or transform the player.

Implement story progression with multiple endings based on Trust/Friendship: a Good Ending at high friendship, and a Betrayal Ending at low friendship with Special Edition variants (complete assimilation at very low friendship; 'Purlin' shared-mind fusion at slightly higher but still low friendship).
Add a 'Memorable Moments' feature that lets players revisit unlocked heartwarming scenes (e.g., sitting with Puro on his mat; watching him eat a snack).
Add a Letter Writing system: players can write short letters and place them in vents; letters are saved and can later receive an in-game response (non-hostile, friendly tone).
Set the game’s tone and presentation to calm, cozy, and slightly melancholic with English on-screen text; include lofi retro-style piano background music and basic sound toggles.

Resolve the art-style direction by implementing a coherent 3D visual style that still nods to pixel-art aesthetics (e.g., low-poly geometry with pixelated/retro textures), and apply it consistently across the library, UI, and mini-games.

Create a coherent, distinct visual theme for the UI (colors, typography, layout) that matches the cozy library mood; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette and apply the theme consistently across menus, dialogue UI, and HUD.
Add basic game state management: new game/continue, autosave on key events (dialogue choice, activity completion, customization placement), and a way to reset progress.
Add a dedicated frontend startup file that centralizes all app initialization logic (startup sequence) so the game can be launched reliably and consistently.
Add a small developer-facing startup documentation file that explains how the project starts and which file is the startup entrypoint.

Ensure the game reliably transitions from the Title screen to gameplay when the user clicks the start action ("New Game" and "Continue"), and prevent silent failures that leave the app appearing to not start.

Add a top-level runtime error boundary around the gameplay rendering path (including the React Three Fiber Canvas / scene) so that runtime exceptions (e.g., texture loading failures, WebGL issues) are caught and surfaced to the user with English error text and a recovery option.

Harden the asset startup and in-game asset loading flow so missing static assets do not prevent the game from starting (e.g., generated textures or audio files). Where assets are required for rendering, provide safe fallbacks instead of throwing.

Add lightweight startup + navigation diagnostics in the UI to help identify why startup/game launch failed (without requiring devtools), including a clear indicator of whether startup initialization completed and whether the game view mounted successfully.

Detect Internet Computer replica rejection errors where the reject_message contains "is stopped" (e.g., IC0508 / reject_code 5) for backend calls used to start gameplay (startNewGame, continueGame), and convert them into a user-friendly, English error summary that clearly indicates the game server is temporarily offline/stopped and the user should try again later.

Add a retry path on the launch error screen that allows the user to retry the last failed launch action (New Game or Continue) without requiring a full page refresh, and ensure the UI reflects retry-in-progress state and prevents double-submission.

Implement a small, centralized frontend error-normalization utility for backend actor call failures used during launch so that App diagnostics and GameLaunchErrorScreen can present consistent summaries (e.g., distinguish "no saved game" vs "canister stopped" vs generic connectivity errors), without losing the original raw error message for technical details.

Add a frontend preflight check that verifies backend availability on the Title screen and immediately before invoking New Game / Continue, and present clear English UI when the server is offline/stopped.

Add a small, developer-facing operations document that explains how to keep the Internet Computer game canister online in production (e.g., ensure it is started and funded with cycles) and clarifies the platform limitation that a stopped canister cannot be programmatically restarted by the canister itself.

Eliminate the React runtime error "Maximum update depth exceeded" that occurs during gameplay initialization by fixing any render/update loops triggered by state updates inside effects or lifecycle-equivalent logic (e.g., repeated store resets, unstable effect dependencies).

Make gameplay initialization in `frontend/src/game/GameView.tsx` resilient to React re-renders and Strict Mode double-invocation by ensuring `initializeGame(isNewGame)` is not repeatedly invoked in a way that causes continuous state updates. Add a guard so initialization runs only when appropriate (e.g., once per mount and/or only when `isNewGame` changes meaningfully).

Stabilize effect dependencies involved in gameplay mount to prevent re-running initialization due to unstable function identities (e.g., `playBackgroundMusic` from `frontend/src/game/audio/useAudio.ts`). Ensure any functions used in `GameView` effects are memoized or invoked from effects that cannot repeatedly trigger store updates.
Add an in-app terminal UI that can be opened from both the Title Screen flow and during gameplay, showing a scrollable output area and a command input field (English UI text only).

Implement a small built-in command set for the terminal focused on diagnostics (not arbitrary code execution), including commands to view help, clear the log, and check backend availability by calling the existing backend availability check (actor.isAvailable).

Expose useful app/game diagnostics in the terminal output, including current screen context and the most recent launch diagnostics (startupComplete, lastLaunchAction, launchStage, gameMounted, last error), so users can self-diagnose why New Game/Continue failed.
Add safe open/close interactions for the terminal, including a keyboard shortcut on desktop (e.g., Ctrl+` or `) and a close button, without interfering with existing gameplay controls on mobile.
Ensure the terminal is explicitly diagnostic-only: it must not claim to be able to start/stop/restart the backend canister, and it must not attempt to execute arbitrary shell commands.
Add an in-app on/off switch that toggles whether the app is allowed to call the backend canister (local “server access” toggle), and persist this preference across page reloads.

Integrate the server access toggle into the Title Screen so that when server access is disabled, New Game and Continue are disabled and the user is shown a clear English explanation that backend calls are disabled locally.
Extend the Diagnostic Terminal command set to support toggling the local server access switch (diagnostic-only), and update terminal help text accordingly.

Update the Title Screen server toggle UI to match the user’s “online/offline” wording while clearly communicating that the switch only controls local backend access (it does not start/stop the Internet Computer canister).

Add a compact, always-visible server status indicator on the Title Screen near the server toggle that reflects the current state (Local Offline, Checking, Online, Offline/Unhealthy) using the existing backend availability check state.
Add a username-based admin access mechanism (local-only) that unlocks admin-only UI controls when the entered username exactly matches a single configured username.

Hide admin-only controls on the Title Screen unless admin mode is unlocked, including the Online/Offline server access toggle, server status indicator, and the button that opens the Diagnostic Terminal.

Hide admin-only controls during gameplay unless admin mode is unlocked, including access to the Diagnostic Terminal from the Pause Menu, and prevent the keyboard shortcut from opening the terminal when not in admin mode.
Provide an in-app way to lock/logout admin mode (clear the stored admin state) from the same place where the username is entered, with clear English feedback.
Update the local-only admin username gate so that admin mode unlocks only when the entered username exactly matches "hood" (case-sensitive), replacing the current configured admin username.

Add a developer-facing deployment troubleshooting guide that explains how to retry a failed network deployment and how to diagnose common deployment failures for this Internet Computer app (including canister stopped / out-of-cycles scenarios and how to verify canister status before re-deploying). All documentation text must be in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a 3D mobile game with touch/mobile-friendly controls
Single-location setting: explorable cozy/dim library hub with bookshelves, vents, and a central fruit-bearing bonsai tree
Relationship system: Trust/Friendship meter that affects dialogue openness, interactions, and endings
Interactive dialogue tree system for conversations and questions about lore/backstory
Hangout/daily routine system (reading together, listening to stories, feeding bonsai oranges)
Cozy mini-games: book sorting, drawing lessons/viewing drawings, hide-and-seek among shelves
Library customization via items found in vents to decorate/upgrade the space

Multiple endings including low-friendship Betrayal ending where Colin becomes Puro’s host; Special Edition variants (complete assimilation vs shared-mind 'Purlin' fusion) based on how low friendship is
Good ending path: help Puro find a sustainable way to live in the lab and create a permanent home together
Atmosphere/audio direction: calm, cozy, slightly melancholic tone with lofi retro-style piano soundtrack
Feature to revisit iconic/heartwarming moments (e.g., sitting on mat, watching Puro eat a snack)
Letter-writing system: write letters placed in vents hoping for responses from friendly latex creatures
Safety mechanic: no transfurring on contact; accidental contact treated as benign (hug/playful shove)
Add a startup/entrypoint file to the project so the game can be launched/run reliably (build/deployment entrypoint)
Ensure the game server/backend canister is always online (high availability) so New Game/Continue do not fail due to the canister being stopped
Add a lightweight backend availability endpoint that the frontend can call to confirm the game canister is running before attempting launch actions.
Add an in-app terminal/console for the game (developer/user-facing) to run/view commands or diagnostics (e.g., server/backend status)
Add an in-app switch/control to turn the game server/backend (IC canister) on/off from the UI (e.g., via the terminal)
Gate admin-only UI switches behind a specific in-app username (instead of Internet Identity principal)
